identity.description: The managed service identities assigned to this resource.

location.description: The geo-location where the resource lives

systemData.description: Azure Resource Manager metadata containing createdBy and modifiedBy information.

pipeline.description: Pipeline to use to transfer data

forceDisabledStatus.description: Force disablement status of the current connection

linkStatus.description: Link status of the current connection

linkedConnectionId.description: Resource ID of the linked connection

flowTypes.description: The flow types being requested for this connection. This FlowType property has reached end of life support starting version 2025-05-30-preview. Please create a FlowProfile resource instead.

remoteSubscriptionId.description: Subscription ID to link cloud subscriptions together

dateSubmitted.description: The timestamp that this connection request was submitted at

primaryContact.description: The primary contact for this connection request

secondaryContacts.description: The secondary contacts for this connection request

policies.description: The policies for this connection. The policies property has reached end of life support starting version 2025-05-30-preview. Please create and use a FlowProfile resource instead.

schemas.description: The schemas for this connection. The schemas property has reached end of life support starting version 2025-05-30-preview. Please create and use a FlowProfile resource instead.

schemaUris.description: The schema URIs for this connection. The schemaUris property has reached end of life support starting version 2025-05-30-preview. Please create and use a FlowProfile resource instead.

pipeline.description: The name of the parent Pipeline Azure resource associated with this FlowProfile.

replicationScenario.description: The data replication scenario handled by this FlowProfile. Please note, that this value cannot be updated after creation. See the FlowProfilePatchProperties to see updateable properties.

flowProfileId.description: A guid represented as a string for the FlowProfile resource, assigned by the system.

status.description: The operational status of the FlowProfile.

description.description: A description of the FlowProfile and its rulesets. The description should describe the flowprofile's purpose and rulesets applied.

connectionId.description: Connection ID associated with this schema

schemaUri.description: Uri containing SAS token for the zipped schema

principalId.description: The service principal ID of the system assigned identity. This property will only be provided for a system assigned identity.

tenantId.description: The tenant ID of the system assigned identity. This property will only be provided for a system assigned identity.

type.description: Type of managed service identity (where both SystemAssigned and UserAssigned types are allowed).

userAssignedIdentities.description: The set of user assigned identities associated with the resource. The userAssignedIdentities dictionary keys will be ARM resource ids in the form: '/subscriptions/{subscriptionId}/resourceGroups/{resourceGroupName}/providers/Microsoft.ManagedIdentity/userAssignedIdentities/{identityName}. The dictionary values can be empty objects ({}) in requests.

principalId.description: The principal ID of the assigned identity.

clientId.description: The client ID of the assigned identity.

createdBy.description: The identity that created the resource.

createdByType.description: The type of identity that created the resource.

lastModifiedBy.description: The identity that last modified the resource.

lastModifiedByType.description: The type of identity that last modified the resource.

lastModifiedAt.description: The timestamp of resource last modification (UTC)

properties.description: The set of configurable properties for the Pipeline resource.

identity.description: The managed service identities assigned to this resource.

location.description: The geo-location where the resource lives

systemData.description: Azure Resource Manager metadata containing createdBy and modifiedBy information.

remoteCloud.description: Remote cloud of the data to be transferred or received

policies.description: The policies for this pipeline. The policies property has reached end of life support starting version 2025-05-30-preview. Please create and use a FlowProfile resource instead.

flowTypes.description: The flow type for this flow. The flowTypes property has reached end of life support starting version 2025-05-30-preview. Please create and use a FlowProfile resource instead.

disabledFlowTypes.description: The flow types that are disabled for this pipeline

disabledDataClass.description: The DataClasses that are disabled for this pipeline

systemData.description: Metadata pertaining to creation and last modification of the resource.

internalMetadata.description: Internal metadata of the connection inside pipeline.

operationStatus.description: Operation status associated with the last patch request

statusSetBy.description: User that last set the approved status for this connection

status.description: Operation status for the last patch request for this connection.

id.description: Operation status ID of the last patch request for this connection.

message.description: Message for the operation for the last patch request for this connection.

notifications.description: Number specifying what notifications to receive

identity.description: The managed service identities assigned to this resource.

location.description: The geo-location where the resource lives

systemData.description: Azure Resource Manager metadata containing createdBy and modifiedBy information.

connection.description: The connection associated with this flow

flowId.description: Dataflow GUID associated with this flow

keyVaultUri.description: URI to a Key Vault Secret containing a SAS token.

linkStatus.description: Link status of the current flow

linkedFlowId.description: Resource ID of the linked flow

forceDisabledStatus.description: Force disablement status of the current flow

flowProfile.description: Type of FlowProfile to use for transfer via the flow.

flowType.description: The flow type for this flow. The property has reached end of life support starting version 2025-05-30-preview. Please create and use a FlowProfile resource instead.

dataType.description: Type of data to transfer via the flow. The property has reached end of life support starting version 2025-05-30-preview. Please create and use a FlowProfile resource instead.

policies.description: The policies for this flow. The property has reached end of life support starting version 2025-05-30-preview. Please create and use a FlowProfile resource instead.

schema.description: The selected schema for this flow. The property has reached end of life support starting version 2025-05-30-preview. Please create and use a FlowProfile resource instead.

messagingOptions.description: The messaging options for this flow

apiFlowOptions.description: The API Flow configuration options for Azure Data Transfer API Flow type.

customerManagedKeyVaultUri.description: The URI to the customer managed key for this flow

streamLatency.description: The latency of the stream in milliseconds

passphrase.description: The passphrase used for SRT streams

sourceAddresses.description: The source IP address and CIDR ranges of the stream

destinationEndpoints.description: The destination endpoints of the stream

destinationEndpointPorts.description: The destination endpoint ports of the stream

subscriptionName.description: Name of the subscription with the connection

billingTier.description: Billing tier for this messaging flow

performancePriority.description: Field indicating whether to enable guaranteed delivery on the flow or not. The default disabled option chooses speed over consistency. When enabled, messages are delivered with minimal delay, but delivery is not guaranteed under all conditions

remoteEndpoint.description: Remote host to which communication needs to be made. The property has reached end of life support starting version 2025-05-30-preview. Please create and use the remoteEndpointSettings.endpoint property instead.

cname.description: Unique CNAME to represent the Azure Data Transfer API Flow instance

apiMode.description: Remote Calling Mode in the Azure Data Transfer API Flow, which describes how the API Flow will be invoked

identityTranslation.description: Determines which identity to use for extracting the user token for Azure Data Transfer API Flow. The property has reached end of life support starting version 2025-05-30-preview. Please create and use the authentication property instead.

senderClientId.description: Sender's app user assigned Manage Identity client ID. The property has reached end of life support starting version 2025-05-30-preview. Please create and use the authentication property instead.

remoteCallingModeClientId.description: Remote stub app registration Client ID. The property has reached end of life support starting version 2025-05-30-preview. Please create and use the authentication property instead.

audienceOverride.description: Optional field to override the audience of the remote endpoint. The property has reached end of life support starting version 2025-05-30-preview. Please create and use the authentication property instead.

authentication.description: Optional and for advanced used only. A list of authentication methods to use when accessing the Azure Data Transfer API Flow. If not provided, the default S2S authentication using Entra (API Flow Managed Identity) and RBAC will be applied.

remoteEndpointSettings.description: Defines the destination remote endpoint for the API calls.

type.description: Type of authentication mechanism. JWT by default.

instance.description: The identity provider's token service instance.

tenantId.description: A unique identifier representing the tenant of the identity provider's token service.

authority.description: The full URL endpoint used to acquire tokens, typically combining the instance and tenant ID to target a specific authentication context.

applicationIds.description: List of applicationIds allowed to authorize to this flow. This is used as an alternative to the RBAC authorization check.

audience.description: Audience of the identity of the remote endpoint service. By default, remoteEndpointSettings.endpoint will be used if a value is not provided.

clientIdOverride.description: The Flow can use an Entra app identity that is provided by the Flow user to obtain the token to call the remote endpoint. This field specifies the user provided app's clientId.

identityTranslation.description: Determines which identity to use for extracting the user token for Azure Data Transfer API Flow.

endpoint.description: The remote endpoint uri all API calls.

authentication.description: Optional and for advanced used only. A list of authentication methods to use when accessing the remote endpoint. If not provided, the default S2S authentication using Entra (API Flow Managed Identity) and RBAC will be applied.

sourceAddresses.description: A source IP address or CIDR range

name.description: A user defined name of the 3rd Party Artifact that is being procured.

publisher.description: The publisher of the 3rd Party Artifact that is being bought. E.g. NewRelic

product.description: The 3rd Party artifact that is being procured. E.g. NewRelic. Product maps to the OfferID specified for the artifact at the time of Data Market onboarding.

promotionCode.description: A publisher provided promotion code as provisioned in Data Market for the said product/artifact.

version.description: The version of the desired product/artifact.

properties.description: The set of configuration properties that define the behavior and rules of the FlowProfile.

identity.description: The managed service identities assigned to this resource.

location.description: The geo-location where the resource lives

systemData.description: Azure Resource Manager metadata containing createdBy and modifiedBy information.

provisioningState.description: The current provisioning state of the FlowProfile.

flowProfileId.description: A guid represented as a string for the FlowProfile resource, assigned by the system.

replicationScenario.description: The data replication scenario handled by this FlowProfile. Please not, that this value cannot be updated after creation.

status.description: The operational status of the FlowProfile.

description.description: A user-defined description of the FlowProfile.

rulesets.description: A set of configurable rulesets applied to this FlowProfile.

antivirus.description: Antivirus scanning rules for replicated data.

archives.description: Rules for handling archive files during replication.

dataSize.description: Rules that enforce minimum and maximum data size limits.

mimeFilters.description: Rules for filtering files based on MIME types.

xmlFilters.description: Rules for filtering XML content using XSD schemas.

textMatching.description: Rules for detecting and blocking specific text patterns.

avSolutions.description: Optional. The list of antiviruses to be used as a scanning solution for replicating data.

minimumSizeForExpansion.description: Optional. Default is 0. The minimum archive file size (in bytes) required to trigger expansion during replication. Any archive file size below the configured threshold will skip the rest of the configured rulesets for archives.

maximumExpansionSizeLimit.description: Optional. The combined maximum size (in bytes) of all extracted files that an expanded archive is allowed to reach. Archives exceeding the max limit will be denied for replication.

maximumDepthLimit.description: Optional. The maximum depth of nested archives that can be expanded. Limits how many layers of embedded archives will be processed. Archives exceeding the max limit will be denied for replication.

maximumCompressionRatioLimit.description: Optional. Provides the multiplication value for an archive in total based on the initial object being validated. This value takes the root object size and multiplies it by this value to create a maximum. Once this maximum is exceeded, the archive is failed. Used to detect and block archives with suspiciously high compression (e.g., zip bombs).

maximum.description: Optional. Specifies the maximum allowed size (in bytes) for files to be replicated. Any file size greater than maximum will be denied replication.

minimum.description: Optional. Default is 0. Specifies the minimum required size (in bytes) for a file to be eligible for replication. Any file size less than minimum will be denied replication.

type.description: Specifies whether the filter is an allow list or deny list. For more detail, please refer to the FilterType model.

filters.description: Defines the Media types (f.k.a MIME types) and associated file extensions to be filtered. For more detail, please refer to the MimeTypeFiler model.

media.description: The Media Types (f.k.a MIME types), following IANA standards (e.g., application/json, image/png). For a more detailed list of allowed media types please refer to the Tika documentation: https://github.com/apache/tika/blob/main/tika-core/src/main/resources/org/apache/tika/mime/tika-mimetypes.xml

extensions.description: A list of file extensions associated with the specified Media type (e.g., .json, .png). To specify files with no extension, use an empty string ""."

defaultNamespace.description: The default XML namespace used for schema validation.

reference.description: Defines the method for referencing the xml schema.

schema.description: The inline XSD schema to be used for validation.

deny.description: A list of text patterns to block, each with matching rules and case sensitivity options.

text.description: The word or phrase to match against replicated content. A phrase with spaces will be considered a single substring.

matchType.description: Specifies the text matching condition for text comparison. For more detail please refer to the MatchType model.

caseSensitivity.description: Specifies the text matching conditions based on casing. For more detail please refer to the Casing model.
